page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF BLOCK
page.content: This area consists of a river valley, that of the river South Esk, with hills rising to 500-600 metres above sea level on either side. The part of the valley which runs through the block lies in a NW-NE direction. The area is sparsely populated with only 2O permanent residents and 3 seasonal workers contained in 9 households. The only road running through the block is the B955. This is not a through road for vehicles. The main buildings apart from dwelling houses are a primary school, a hall, a church and a hotel. The land is mainly devoted to sheep farming, forestry and game such as grouse, pheasants, partridges and red and roe deer.
